subject: Re: learning
msgSnippet: Like the music teachers always say, The best way to learn something is practice practice practice.  Though I d personally recommend perhaps copying different
messageBody:
Like the music teachers always say, "The best way to learn something
is practice practice practice." Though I'd personally recommend
perhaps copying different books instead of the same book so you don't
get bored with it or simply learn to write that book in your sleep.

Try using it in your everyday life if you can. I take class notes
with QS, then copy them back to the latin alphabet later. Sort of a
way to learn to translate from Standard -> QS -> Standard.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "nerd_the_mighty"
<nerd_the_mighty@...> wrote:
>
> just a quik question would learning quickscript by copying a book
> until fluent be an effetive way of learning?
>
